headline: Thermo Fisher, Biogen, Gilead Sciences, Moderna, and QuidelOrtho Stocks Trade Up, What You Need To Know
text: A number of stocks jumped in the afternoon session after the major indices popped (Nasdaq +3.4%, S&P 500 +2.5%) in response to the positive outcome of U.S.-China trade negotiations, as both sides agreed to pause some tariffs for 90 days, signaling a potential turning point in ongoing tensions. This rollback cuts U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods to 30% and Chinese tariffs on U.S. imports to 10%, giving companies breathing room to reset inventories and supply chains.

text: Thermo Fisher Scientific (NYSE:TMO) has announced a new collaboration with RoosterBio to enhance the availability of cell and exosome therapies for treating degenerative diseases, a development that aligns with their focus on advanced therapy manufacturing. headline: Thermo Fisher Scientific (NYSE:TMO) Completes US$3 Billion Buyback and Reports Rising Q1 Earnings
text: Thermo Fisher Scientific (NYSE:TMO) reported significant growth in its recent earnings report, with net income and earnings per share both showing year-over-year increases. The company also completed a share buyback program, repurchasing a substantial amount of its shares, underlining its commitment to shareholder value. Despite this solid performance, Thermo Fisher's share price was flat over the past week, aligning with broader positive market movements driven by optimism around earnings...

headline: Thermo Fisher counters tariffs with $2bn investment into US manufacturing

headline: 3 Healthcare Stocks with Mounting Challenges
text: Personal health and wellness is one of the many secular tailwinds for healthcare companies. Despite the rosy long-term prospects, short-term headwinds such as COVID inventory destocking have harmed the industry’s returns - over the past six months, healthcare stocks have collectively shed 12.7%. This performance was worse than the S&P 500’s 7.5% fall.

headline: Thermo Fisher Scientific Invests to Enhance U.S. Innovation and Support Customers’ Manufacturing
text: WALTHAM, Mass., April 24, 2025--Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO), the world leader in serving science, will invest an additional $2 billion in the United States over the next four years, strengthening American innovation, manufacturing and economic competitiveness across the life sciences sector.

headline: TMO Q1 Earnings Call: Navigating Tariffs and Macro Uncertainty While Investing in Innovation
text: Life sciences company Thermo Fisher (NYSE:TMO) reported revenue ahead of Wall Street’s expectations in Q1 CY2025, but sales were flat year on year at $10.36 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $5.15 per share was 0.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates. The stock remained flat at $433.50 following the earnings release and call.

headline: Thermo Fisher (TMO) Reports Q1 Earnings: What Key Metrics Have to Say
text: While the top- and bottom-line numbers for Thermo Fisher (TMO) give a sense of how the business performed in the quarter ended March 2025, it could be worth looking at how some of its key metrics compare to Wall Street estimates and year-ago values.

headline: Thermo Fisher cuts 2025 profit forecast on tariff hit, research funding cuts
text: (Reuters) -Medical equipment maker Thermo Fisher Scientific on Wednesday cut its annual profit forecast, in anticipation of a potential hit from the U.S. and China tariff war and the Trump administration's proposed cuts to academic research funding. The company estimates a $400 million hit this year to its sales in China, which represents about 8% of Thermo Fisher's business. Chief Financial Officer Stephen Williamson said sales of the company's products in China that were produced in U.S. facilities would be affected.

headline: Thermo Fisher Scientific (TMO) Q1 Earnings and Revenues Beat Estimates
text: Thermo Fisher (TMO) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of 0.98% and 1.11%, respectively, for the quarter ended March 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Thermo Fisher Scientific tops Q1 estimates, shares rise
text: Investing.com -- Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc (NYSE:TMO) reported first-quarter earnings on Wednesday that exceeded analyst expectations, driving shares up 3.5% in response to the positive results.

headline: Thermo Fisher (NYSE:TMO) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q1
text: Life sciences company Thermo Fisher (NYSE:TMO) reported Q1 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, but sales were flat year on year at $10.36 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $5.15 per share was 0.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
